memberdef.argsstring: (const char *portName, const char *camid, int maxBuffers, size_t maxMemory, int priority, int stackSize)
memberdef.name: FirewireWinDCAM

briefdescription.para: Constructor for the FirewireWinDCAM class Initialises the camera object by setting all the default parameters and initializing the camera hardware with it.

detaileddescription.para:
This function also reads out the current settings of the camera and prints out a selection of parameters to the shell.
portName
Asyn port name to assign to the camera driver.
camid
The camera ID or serial number in a hexadecimal string. Lower case and upper case letters can be used. This is used to identify a specific camera on the bus. For instance: "0x00b09d01007139d0". If this parameter is empty ("") then the first camera found on the Firewire bus will be used.
maxBuffers
Maxiumum number of NDArray objects (image buffers) this driver is allowed to allocate. This driver requires 2 buffers, and each queue element in a plugin can require one buffer which will all need to be added up in this parameter. Use -1 for unlimited.
maxMemory
Maximum memory (in bytes) that this driver is allowed to allocate. So if max. size = 1024x768 (8bpp) and maxBuffers is, say 14. maxMemory = 1024x768x14 = 11010048 bytes (~11MB). Use -1 for unlimited.
priority
The EPICS thread priority for this asyn port driver. 0=use asyn default.
stackSize
The size of the stack for the asyn port thread. 0=use asyn default.

briefdescription.para: Sets an int32 parameter.

detaileddescription.para:
pasynUser
asynUser structure that contains the function code in pasynUser->reason.
value
The value for this parameter
Takes action if the function code requires it. ADAcquire, ADSizeX, and many other function codes make calls to the Firewire library from this function.

briefdescription.para: Sets an float64 parameter.

detaileddescription.para:
pasynUser
asynUser structure that contains the function code in pasynUser->reason.
value
The value for this parameter
Takes action if the function code requires it. The FDC_feat_val_abs function code makes calls to the Firewire library from this function.

briefdescription.para: Print out a report; calls ADDriver::report to get base class report as well.

parameterdescription.para: File pointer to write output to
Level of detail desired. If >1 prints information about supported video formats and modes, etc.

briefdescription.para: This should be private but is called from C callback function, must be public.

detaileddescription.para: Task to grab images off the camera and send them up to areaDetector.

briefdescription.para: Grabs one image off the dc1394 queue, notifies areaDetector about it and finally clears the buffer off the dc1394 queue.

detaileddescription.para: This function expects the driver to be locked already by the caller!

briefdescription.para: Check if a requested feature is valid.

detaileddescription.para: Valid range of the asyn request address against feature index. Availability of the requested feature in the current camera.

pasynUser featInfo Pointer to a feature info structure pointer. The function will write a valid feature info struct into this pointer or NULL on error. featureName The function will return a string in this parameter with a readable name for the given feature. functionName The caller can pass a string which contain the callers function name. For debugging/printing purposes only. asyn status

briefdescription.para: Set the framerate in the camera.
Read all the feature settings and values from the camera.

detaileddescription.para: This function will collect all the current values and settings from the camera, and set the appropriate integer/double parameters in the param lib. If a certain feature is not available in the given camera, this function will set all the parameters relating to that feature to -1 or -1.0 to indicate it is not available. Note the caller is responsible for calling any update callbacks if I/O interrupts are to be processed after calling this function. Returns asynStatus asynError or asynSuccess as an int.

briefdescription.para: Parse a dc1394 error code into a user readable string Defaults to printing out using the pasynUser.

parameterdescription.para: The error code, returned from the dc1394 function call. If the error code is OK we just ignore it.
Line number where the error came from.

briefdescription.para: Main driver class inherited from areaDetectors ADDriver class.

detaileddescription.para: One instance of this class will control one firewire camera on the bus.
